pageContext.claim: “Yesterday Virginia, 500,000 applications for ballots, got sent to everybody, nobody even knows. Got sent to dogs, got sent to dead people, nobody has no idea what happened.”
pageContext.analysis: The Center For Voter Information did send 500,000 applications for ballots out to Fairfax County voters in Virginia. There’s no indication that they went to dogs or dead people. Rather, they included an incorrect return address information. The county registration did not believe the action was malicious — just sloppy.
